ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course builds off L3 and deepens understanding of Italian culture and history, while fine-tuning grammar skills.
I gained skills in learning how to read Italian better and improved my grammar.
Became really comfortable with the language and learned a lot of the history and culture of Italy through various types of resources (movies, books etc.)
I developed stronger fluency in Italian and greater familiarity with Italian culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course includes many interesting films, which provoke great class discussion. Also, there is less busywork compared to earlier levels, which makes class very enjoyable.
This course is great the way it is, I can't think of very many ways to improve it.
Strengths of the course were learning how to write better and read Italian text better. Weaknesses included too many movies and not enough speaking.
i didn't think there were weaknesses. It was very open to discussion and great environment to learn in. Methods of teaching worked really well.
Strengths: The material is intrinsically interesting; so much so that I sometimes wish we could go in greater depth in discussing history. Weaknesses: Nothing to report

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend this course to another student. The classroom environment is very open and embracing and provides a fun and engaging space for learning! I loved coming to class everyday.

Simone is the sweetest person but I do feel like thebcourse could be more challenging to improve our Italian speaking skills. However, the Italian department at Yale is so wonderful and they really want to improve students skills and get them excited about learning Italian.
100% recommend this course. You will enjoy it and learn a ton.
So highly recommended. Simona is fantastic, and the knowledge you gain of Italian is well worth going beyond the intro language requirements.
I would definitely recommend the course.
